div.p: Bigotry has no place Homosexuals often face cruel predjudice. Nationally, homosexuals and bisexuals are often the butt of cruel jokes, pranks and assualts. While a major hate crime against a homosexual has not been reported on this campus recently, students are calling for a study on campus attitudes towards homosexuality.Homosexuals are a part of this campus community. When predjudice prevents them from being produc­ tive members of our community, the university as a whole suffers. Students like Steve Kalathas are calling for the creation of an ad-hoc Committee for Sexual Orientation and Student Equity. The committee would include heterosexuals and homosexuals, and would look into the way gays are treated. Kalathas should be commended for his efforts to disprove myths that surround homosexuality. Kalathas' attempt to attract heterosexuals into the fight for homosexual equality shows he is serious about getting something done. Some of the issues that should be explored include homosexual rentention rates, hate crimes and discrimination by students, staff and faculty. It’s time for the campus to recognize the problems that homosexuals face, research these problems and deal with them decisively. Bigotry again.-, anyone has no place on this campus.
